newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore rubber trade languishes on weak demand.
newsitem.headline: Singapore rubber trade languishes on weak demand.

text.p: Trading in the Singapore rubber market struggled to a difficult close on Monday as weak consumer demand depressed market players, dealers said.

"It's too quiet for me to say anything. I've heard nothing from the big boys," a trader said, refering to the fact that no requests for offers were seen from major buyers like Goodyear or Bridgestone.
"It looks quite bad. There's just no strong demand seen in the market. There were no offers at all," another trader said.
News the Thai government was seeking 5,000 tonnes of RSS3 grade rubber was ignored by market players.
Traders said most consumers were still waiting on the sidelines, betting that prices for items like SIR20 rubber would head lower.
They said prices of SIR20 rubber will likely slide to around 47-48 U.S. cents a kg from the current level of 49 cents.
At around 0945 GMT, May RSS3 was seen at 116.00-117.00 U.S. cents a kg from 117.50 cents.
July RSS1 was seen at 169.00-171.00 Singapore cents (US$1.17-$1.18) a kg from 171.50 cents. October/December TSR20 was seen at 114.00-116.00 U.S. cents a kg from 116.00 cents.
